Info

Delivery via recommender systems is a key application of AI in the social media industry. This means AI analyzes user behavior, preferences, and interactions. It utilizes your information to promote some videos based on the user preferences and ensures high engagement and relevance to viewer by ranking all the video options in its internal system.

Media and content posted on social media platforms can be stolen very easily, bringing up a privacy concern. However, it is not just AI that can utilize your image from your content, it is also other people from the platforms

AI algorithms can identify when users are engaging with mental health-related content—such as posts about anxiety, depression, or self-care—and begin recommending supportive resources, uplifting messages, or communities focused on well-being. For example, platforms like Instagram or TikTok may surface mental health advocates, calming videos, or coping strategies tailored to the user’s emotional state. This kind of personalization can be life-changing for individuals who feel isolated or overwhelmed, especially those who may not seek help directly. It creates a quiet, non-invasive way to offer emotional support and connect people to communities that understand their struggles.

Recommender systems often show users content like what they've already interacted with. This can limit exposure to diverse viewpoints and reinforce existing beliefs, contributing to polarization and reducing critical thinking.
